title: Paris 2024: Cultural institutions anxious over lack of details as Games approach
summary: In Paris, museums, theaters and concert halls are feeling uneasy, seven months before the Games. They face unpredictable opening times, with partial, total or sporadic closures.

title: US Supreme Court to decide on Trump's eligibility for Colorado primary ballot
summary: The United States' highest court said Friday it will decide whether former President Donald Trump can be kept off the ballot because of his efforts to overturn his 2020 election loss.

title: French report blasts ineffective policies to combat illegal immigration
summary: In a detailed report, France's top audit institution criticized the 'uncertain effectiveness' of border controls and urged the government to review its 'overall strategy.'

title: US sends a warning to pro-Iran militias by targeting high-ranking commander
summary: The US strike in Baghdad against a high-ranking official in the Al-Nujaba militia was presented as a response to the hundred or so attacks carried out by Tehran's allies against US bases in Iraq and Syria since October 7.

title: In Senegal, soaring fertilizer prices are pushing market gardeners to the brink
summary: Fertilizers represent a critical aspect of food security, highlighting Africa's reliance on imports that are vulnerable to global shocks.

title: France pauses demolition of a site attributed to Marie Curie
summary: Culture Minister Rima Abdul Malak announced the freeze on the demolition of the Pavillon des Sources, in a decision aimed at finding a comprise between critics of the demolition and the Curie Institute, which wants to build a research center at the site.

title: Biden launches 2024 campaign accusing Trump of echoing Nazi rhetoric
summary: US President Joe Biden warned on Friday that Donald Trump's 2024 presidential campaign is a significant threat to the US, a day before the third anniversary of the Capitol riot by Trump's supporters.

title: Hezbollah chief says response to assassination of Hamas number two in Beirut is 'inevitable'
summary: Saleh al-Arouri and six other officials in the Palestinian movement were killed on Tuesday evening in a strike attributed to Israel.

title: War in Ukraine: On the front line, enemy artillery units come face to face
summary: For more than a year, the same Ukrainian and Russian artillery units have been battling it out on either side of the front – an exhausting duel in which the Russians are gaining the upper hand.

title: NRA chief executive Wayne LaPierre steps down
summary: His resignation comes just days before a corruption trial investigating his spending of millions of dollars using NRA money.

title: Senegal court rules that Senegalese opposition leader Sonko cannot run in presidential election
summary: This is the latest blow for Ousmane Sonko, whose presidential candidacy was rejected on the grounds that his file didn't have the correct documents.

title: Sub-Saharan migrants in Tunisia under threat from kidnapping networks
summary: A new form of human trafficking is on the rise in the North African country, as sub-Saharan Africans are kidnapped by other migrants seeking ransom from relatives.

title: Azerbaijan names ex-oil executive to COP29 presidency
summary: Mukhtar Babayev, Azerbaijan's minister for ecology and natural resources and formerly a state oil company SOCAR executive, has been named president-delegate of the future COP29 – the second petrochemical executive in a row to hold the position.

title: Residents evacuated after North Korea fires artillery shells near South Korean islands
summary: The act was the most serious escalation of tension between the two countries in decades. Seoul responded with live-fire drills of its own.

title: Kept in Denmark since 1689, a coat from the Tupinamba people will be returned to Brazil
summary: The precious native ornament woven from natural fibers and covered with thousands of red ibis feathers, will leave the Scandinavian kingdom's National Museum in 2024 to join the collections of the one located in Rio de Janeiro.

title: France bids farewell to former EU chief Delors
summary: The former president of the European Commission and French finance minister was honored with a state funeral in Paris on Friday, January 5.

title: 'Rue David Bowie': Paris to name street after rock icon
summary: The street on the French capital's Left Bank will honor the British singer, who died eight years ago.

title: West Bank's most prestigious university once again navigates teaching during wartime
summary: Birzeit University, which has switched to virtual classes, has been the target of two Israeli army raids in three months, with students and teachers arrested and others targeted by settlers.

title: China's military purge continues
summary: Beijing appointed a new defense minister while simultaneously declaring the expulsion of nine senior army officers. Eleven years into his presidency, Xi Jinping continues to prioritize the battle against corruption as a central aspect of his governance system.

title: Germany's greenhouse gas emissions fall to their lowest in 70 years
summary: The significant decrease can largely be attributed to the decline in output from coal-fired power stations and the economic downturn, which led to lower energy demand.

title: Hindu extremists ruthlessly hunt down Christians in India
summary: Eleven Indian states have laws criminalizing religious conversion. These laws are used by nationalists to target Christians with false accusations, harass them, and chase them out of their communities.

title: Christians in Bavaria are visibly asserting their identity
summary: Public buildings in the German state have displayed the Christian cross since 2018, initiated by Bavarian Minister-President Markus Söder. The German counterpart to the French Council of State recently ruled it doesn't infringe on freedom of belief.

title: US Supreme Court allows Idaho to enforce strict abortion ban pending hearing
summary: The Court, planning to hear arguments in April, temporarily set aside a lower court's decision that had suspended the Idaho law in hospital emergencies following a lawsuit by the Biden administration.

title: Africa, the new playground for drone exporters
summary: 'Drones, the new weapon in African warfare' (2/3). China, Israel and Turkey are taking advantage of a growing appetite from the continent's militaries to sell their aircraft.

title: What legacy for Paris 2024? The difficult aftermath of the Athens 2004 Olympics
summary: While the event provided the Greek capital with much-needed infrastructure, the lack of stadium maintenance and the impact of high organization costs on the country's finances tainted the aftermath of the festivities.

title: Six iconic design objects, from the UN chair to the Ankara table
summary: These six designs have gone down in history for their sleek styles and functionality. Now they can be found in people's homes, as a coveted design object.

title: Has the language of sex become too complicated?
summary: Sexual vocabulary is saturated with anglicisms and new expressions, it's not easy to keep up, reports Maïa Mazaurette.
